title: Woman, 24, is killed and another seriously injured when their swing chair crashes to the ground
text:
A woman was killed and another was seriously injured after their swing chair was thrown from a funfair ride in France, emergency services have revealed.

The pair had been more than 33 feet in the air in one of several pods spinning around a central mast when their seat was tossed to the ground in Firminy, near Saint-Étienne, on Monday.

When rescuers arrived at the scene, a 24-year-old woman who had been seated inside the fallen pod was declared dead.

Emergency services at a funfair in Saint-Étienne, France where a woman died and another was injured when they crashed to the ground from a swing chair ride

A second woman, 20, was rushed to hospital to be treated for her injuries, the fire brigade said.

Images from the scene show numerous emergency vehicles parked near to the swing carousel ride as crowds gather close to the scene.

Police said four people - the owners and operators of the swing carousel and a neighbouring attraction - had been taken into custody following the incident.

Experts made their way to the scene on Tuesday to examine the rides, which were both under lockdown, to determine the cause of the tragedy.

The pair had been more than 33 feet up in the air in one of several pods spinning around a central mast when their capsule was tossed to the ground

Images from the scene show numerous emergency vehicles parked near to the swing carousel ride as crowds gather close to the scene

It was said that the pod fell to the ground in very strong winds.

The Firminy funfair is one of France's biggest, held for two weeks in the commune every October with 250 rides and attractions and some 100,000 visitors.

Monday's incident is far from the first time disaster has struck at a funfair in France.

In March last year, a man died when a similar swing ride collapsed near Lyon, throwing out the occupants of 14 pods.

And on December 31, eight people spent much of their New Years Eve stuck up in the air when a giant ride got stuck in the northern city of Rennes.
